DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: FURTADO, L.;FURTADO, L. F.;FURTADO, L. F. A.;DE ALMEIDA FURTADO, LUIZ FELIPE;FURTADO, LUIZ FELIPE DE ALMEIDA;de Almeida, Luiz

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Eu sou Bacharel em Geografia pela Universidade Federal Fluminense e Mestre em Sensoriamento Remoto pelo Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais - INPE. Fui bolsista PCI-DC vinculado a OBT - INPE, onde pesquisei temas relacionados ao sensoriamento remoto envolvendo SAR polarimйtricos para estudos de modelagem e mapeamento de habitats na vбrzea amazфnica. Atualmente sou doutorando em Geografia pela Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro e meus interesses acadкmicos sгo (a) o estudo geossistкmico do meio fнsico e da sua influкncia na distribuiзгo das fisionomias de vegetaзгo na vбrzea do Rio Amazonas, (b) o efeito das mudanзas climбticas no meio fнsico e na vegetaзгo da vбrzea do Rio Amazonas e (c) os impactos а populaзгo humana causados pelas mudanзas do meio fнsico.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: M.Sc. in Remote Sensing at National Institute for Spatial Research - INPE and Bachelor in Geography at Fluminense Federal University. Actually i have a scholarship at INPE, where i research remote sensing using full polarimetric SAR images for modeling and habitat mapping at the Amazon vбrzea.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
Membro ativo do grupo de pesquisa ?Observatуrio de Dinвmicas Ecossistкmicas?, credenciado junto ao Diretуrio de Grupos de Pesquisa do CNPq (http://dgp.cnpq.br/dgp/espelhogrupo/4445994045218308).
Artigos submetidos: Dual-season and full-polarimetric C band SAR assessment for vegetation mapping in the Amazon vбrzea wetlands, para a revista Remote Sensing of Environment.

GRADUACAO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-DE-CONCLUSAO-DE-CURSO: Classificaзгo de fisionomias de vegetaзгo a partir de imagens de altнssima resoluзгo espacial utilizando a abordagem de anбlise de imagens baseada em objeto - limites e potencialidades.

MESTRADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Mapeamento e modelagem da estrutura da vegetaзгo na vбrzea amazфnica utilizando dados polarimйtricos de banda C.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Atuaзгo como monitor das disciplinas de Sensoriamento Remoto I e II, no Departamento de Anбlise Geoambiental, Instituto de Geociкncias.
Bolsista da CAPES para o programa de mestrado em sensoriamento remoto do Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Assessment of PALSAR-2 SAR imagery for monitoring inundation and vegetation distribution, biomass and phenology in the Amazon floodplain wetlands
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The present proposal will evaluate the applicability of PALSAR2 data acquired at multiple modes and resolutions to estimate inundation status, vegetation type, structure and biomass, and habitat degradation in multiple areas of the Amazon floodplain. A combination of object-based image analysis with radiometric, polarimetric and interferometric techniques will be used, and the research will be supported by existing and concurrent field data acquisition on vegetation structure and flooding patterns. The methods will be based on previously successful studies using PALSAR1 and Radarsat-1, Radarsat-2 and TerraSAR-X data. The team composition includes expertise on both SAR remote sensing and Amazon floodplain ecology, ensuring that the developed methods will attend the requirements of the ecological research community. By focusing on well-studied, key areas of the floodplain and leveraging existing and requested funding for field work in these locations, instead of attempting a basin-wide analysis, the present proposal will be able to produce solid results and adequate techniques and deliverables within the expected project duration.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Descriзгo: The present proposal will evaluate the applicability of PALSAR2 data acquired at multiple modes and resolutions to estimate inundation status, vegetation type, structure and biomass, and habitat degradation in multiple areas of the Amazon floodplain. A combination of object-based image analysis with radiometric, polarimetric and interferometric techniques will be used, and the research will be supported by existing and concurrent field data acquisition on vegetation structure and flooding patterns. The methods will be based on previously successful studies using PALSAR1 and Radarsat-1, Radarsat-2 and TerraSAR-X data. The team composition includes expertise on both SAR remote sensing and Amazon floodplain ecology, ensuring that the developed methods will attend the requirements of the ecological research community. By focusing on well-studied, key areas of the floodplain and leveraging existing and requested funding for field work in these locations, instead of attempting a basin-wide analysis, the present proposal will be able to produce solid results and adequate techniques and deliverables within the expected project duration.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Assessment of PALSAR-2 SAR imagery for monitoring inundation and vegetation distribution, biomass and phenology in the Amazon floodplain wetlands

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-COMPLETO: Evlyn Mбrcia Leгo de Moraes Novo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Synergistic use of Radarsat-2 and TerrSAR-X for monitoring vegetation distribution, growth and phenology in the Amazon floodplain wetlands.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The ecological and biogeochemical dynamics of the Amazon wetlands are determined by the annual flooding cycle, including the phenology and distribution of the vegetation, the main source of carbon input to the floodplain. Current studies predict an increase in the frequency and intensity of droughts for the Amazon basin due to climatic change, with likely repercussions on vegetation dynamics and their participation in the carbon budget of the floodplain. The current co-existence of polarimetric L-band (ALOS PALSAR), C-Band (RADARSAT-2) and X-band (TerraSAR-X) systems offers an unprecedented set of possibilities for the monitoring of wetland vegetation. Given the clear need for better quantification of vegetation dynamics in the Amazon floodplain under climate change scenarios, the present study proposes to evaluate the synergistic use of ALOS/PALSAR, RADARSAT 2 and TerraSAR-X to study vegetation communities in the Amazon floodplain, through the following objectives: 1) Evaluate the effectiveness of combined L, C and X band and multiple polarization information in providing an operational, accurate method for vegetation cover mapping and monitoring in the Amazon floodplain environment; 2) Evaluate the effectiveness of L, C and X band and multiple polarization information in discriminating woody vegetation cover and capturing the phenology of woody species in the Amazon floodplain environment; 3) Evaluate the added capabilities of full polarimetric information for discriminating among tree, shrub and macrophyte species in the Amazon floodplain; 4) Evaluate the relative effectiveness of ScanSAR data for large scale mapping of vegetation communities, when compared to standard resolution products; 5) Evaluate the suitability of high-resolution C and X band images as a basis for visual interpretation and validation of classification results, in order to reduce ground truthing efforts for the inaccessible areas of the floodplain.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The ecological and biogeochemical dynamics of the Amazon wetlands are determined by the annual flooding cycle, including the phenology and distribution of the vegetation, the main source of carbon input to the floodplain. Current studies predict an increase in the frequency and intensity of droughts for the Amazon basin due to climatic change, with likely repercussions on vegetation dynamics and their participation in the carbon budget of the floodplain. The current co-existence of polarimetric L-band (ALOS PALSAR), C-Band (RADARSAT-2) and X-band (TerraSAR-X) systems offers an unprecedented set of possibilities for the monitoring of wetland vegetation. Given the clear need for better quantification of vegetation dynamics in the Amazon floodplain under climate change scenarios, the present study proposes to evaluate the synergistic use of ALOS/PALSAR, RADARSAT 2 and TerraSAR-X to study vegetation communities in the Amazon floodplain, through the following objectives: 1) Evaluate the effectiveness of combined L, C and X band and multiple polarization information in providing an operational, accurate method for vegetation cover mapping and monitoring in the Amazon floodplain environment; 2) Evaluate the effectiveness of L, C and X band and multiple polarization information in discriminating woody vegetation cover and capturing the phenology of woody species in the Amazon floodplain environment; 3) Evaluate the added capabilities of full polarimetric information for discriminating among tree, shrub and macrophyte species in the Amazon floodplain; 4) Evaluate the relative effectiveness of ScanSAR data for large scale mapping of vegetation communities, when compared to standard resolution products; 5) Evaluate the suitability of high-resolution C and X band images as a basis for visual interpretation and validation of classification results, in order to reduce ground truthing efforts for the inaccessible areas of the floodplain.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Synergistic use of Radarsat-2 and TerrSAR-X for monitoring vegetation distribution, growth and phenology in the Amazon floodplain wetlands.
